intro: Crepis polyodon, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and thistles, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive lobed shape, while its flowers are usually pale yellow to white. Crepis polyodon is often found in disturbed habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
